title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 135/84 of 19 January 1984 amending for the eighth time Regulation (EEC) No 3172/80 laying down implementing rules in respect of the system of consumption aid for olive oil
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 135/84
of 19 January 1984
amending for the eighth time Regulation (EEC) No 3172/80 laying down implementing rules in respect of the system of consumption aid for olive oil
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Article 12 (b) of Regulation (EEC) No 3172/80 is hereby amended as follows:
1. The sixth indent of the first paragraph is replaced by the following:
'- cholesterol 0,2 %. This percentage must be obtained fom cholesterol not containing toxic impurities for alimentary purposes.'
2. The following paragraph 3 is added:
'3. Member States may exempt by-products from the refining of olive oil or olive-residue oil which are intended for use in that State in the manufacture of soap from the obligation set out in paragraph 1 on condition that they submit the said products as from the moment of production to a permanent control guaranteeing their final processing into soap.'

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 19 January 1984.
For the Commission
Poul DALSAGER
Member of the Commission
